詩仙.definition: "immortal of poetry", epithet of Li Bai 李白[Li3 Bai2]

詩律.definition: meters and forms of versification; prosody

詩情畫意.definition: picturesque charm; idyllic appeal; poetic grace

詩書.definition: the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

詩畫.definition: poetry and pictorial art; work of art combining pictures and poetry

詩禮.definition: the classics a Confucian scholar must read (such as The Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1jing1] and The Book of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3ji4])

詩篇.definition: a poem; a composition in verse; fig. epic (compared with historical epic); the biblical Book of Psalms

詩經.definition: Shijing, the Book of Songs, early collection of Chinese poems and one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1]

詩聖.definition: "sage of poetry", epithet of Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]

詩話.definition: notes on poetry, an essay genre consisting of informal commentary on poems and poets and their lives (old); a genre of narrative literature interspersing prose with poetry, popular in the Tang and Song dynasties
